page.title: 04ST.Peter's Collegiate Church
page.content: St. Peter's Church is the parish church of Irthlingborough and stands near the centre of the town. There has been a church here for many centuries. It was registered in the original Domesday Book as part of the Diocese of Peterborough. Back in the 14th century Irthlingborough manor was purchased from Sir Simon de Drayton by a certain John Pyel. He was a very rich merchant who had been Mayor of London. He set about restoring the church and turned it into a college, not for learning but for religious purposes. It continued until Henry VIII ordered the closure of all such religious establishments.
